Content: I don't know if this is the right spot for PC technical help
if it isn't I'll move it elsewhere
long story short about a week and a half ago I got a "memory management" error
spent about 2 hours trying to do all kinds of tests
trying to find something
and I found corrupted files that my PC managed to fix by itself I guess.
I don't remember the exact things I used but I can dig it out and find it if anyone is curious

I assumed this fixed the problem. The computer worked normally for about 4 days and that day I decided to shut the computer off and take it downstairs for cleaning because I figured it was due for a cleaning. Long story short as the computer was shutting down (literally mid shutdown) I got the error again.
After I got it I went through all the same tests I did earlier and found nothing.
went to the event viewer and found a critical 41 kernal power error
it's been about a week since this happened but I've been afraid to do anything on this PC out of fear that it'll happen again. I've tried to replicate things somewhat but it hasn't happened next.
the only intensive thing I was doing during that entire week was emulating a SNES game. CPU/GPU temps were normal things seemed fine.
I'm just unsure if it was an insolated incident
or if my power supply is going to shit
gotcha
so the memory management error is what I should really be worrying about
error 41 likely happened as a result of that?
gotcha
well I did most of the ram related testing that I can do via windows 10 so I assumed it's fine
did windows memory diagnostic_ and there's another one I did via command prompt in administrator mode
gotcha.
I'll definitely do that if it happens again_ though it hasn't happened in a week
unsure if that means I'm in the clear or not though
I've just been really paranoid to do any gaming on this_ out of fear that it would fry the power supply
